CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection joined to merits and dismissed (Article 35-1 - Exhaustion of domestic remedies);Remainder inadmissible;No violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Torture) (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Effective investigation) (Procedural aspect);Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .

CARDINAL . At the material time the applicant was the director and allegedly the owner of the Passage private company , which provided currency exchange services . On DATE the tax police inspected CARDINAL of the departments of the company , seized some documents and cash assets , and imposed financial sanctions .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was invited to ORG ( GPE міліція Державної податкової інспекції м. Харкова ) to retrieve the documents that had been removed by the tax police . According to the applicant , at TIME , when he entered the office of PERSON , the Head of ORG , and asked when the documents in question would be returned , the latter started to beat him and broke the tape recorder which the applicant had in his pocket . According to the applicant , several people were present at the time in LOC 's office . The latter allegedly told his subordinates not to let the applicant out until TIME At TIME the applicant left ORG premises .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained about these events to the Anti - corruption Department of the Kharkiv Regional State Tax Inspectorate ( PERSON по боротьбі з корупцією Державної податкової інспекції в PERSON області ) . The applicant was sent for a medical examination and his complaint was transferred to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the medical examination revealed that the applicant had suffered minor injuries , and in particular that he had bruises on his abdomen . No head injury was identified .
CARDINAL . From DATE to CARDINAL DATE the applicant was a patient in the neurosurgery department of ORG . CARDINAL . He was diagnosed with concussion and numerous bruises were found on his head .

CARDINAL . On DATE a further forensic medical examination concluded that the applicant was suffering from moderately severe physical injuries ( including a head injury ) which had caused a temporary disability .
CARDINAL . On DATE the financial sanctions against the Passage company were rescinded .

CARDINAL . According to a forensic medical expert opinion of CARDINAL DATE , the applicant 's medical treatment from DATE to CARDINAL DATE was for a head injury , which could have been inflicted on DATE or later . It further stated that , since according to the medical examination of DATE the applicant had not had a head injury , it was impossible to establish a link between the incident of DATE and the applicant 's medical treatment for a head injury .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( прокуратура PERSON ) refused to institute criminal proceedings against PERSON for want of corpus delicti . In particular , PERSON and PERSON ( employees of ORG who had been present in the office during the events in question ) and PERSON . ( a security officer ) testified that the applicant had not been subjected to any kind of physical pressure . S. and PERSON . submitted that the applicant had tried to record his conversation with PERSON and when the latter had asked the applicant to give him the tape recorder , the applicant had dropped it on the floor and stepped on it . PERSON ( an associate of the applicant , who had accompanied him to the Tax Police office ) testified that he had seen the applicant through the window being beaten by S. It was established that it had not been physically possible for PERSON to have seen the events in question ; in any event his testimony was rejected since he was “ an interested person ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE the cash assets seized in DATE were returned to the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's request to institute criminal proceedings against the tax police officers who had carried out the inspection on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( прокуратура PERSON області ) quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE and opened criminal proceedings to investigate the circumstances of the incident of DATE . It was stated that the applicant had indeed received moderately serious physical injuries but that the origin of these injuries was unknown . Therefore , more extensive investigation into the facts of the case was needed .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE CARDINAL additional forensic medical examinations were carried out . The experts held that there was not enough information to conclude that the head injury sustained by the applicant had been received CARDINAL . The bruises on the applicant 's abdomen could have resulted from a blow inflicted DATE before DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG terminated the criminal proceedings for lack of evidence that the applicant had been beaten by S.

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE , in particular because the hospital doctors who had examined the applicant had not been questioned , and remitted the case for additional investigation to ORG ( прокуратура ORG ) .

CARDINAL . By a decision of DATE the investigating officer of ORG refused to recognise the applicant as a victim in the proceedings , on the ground of lack of proof that he had sustained moderately severe physical injuries . Following this decision the applicant refused to testify or participate in the investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE an investigator of ORG terminated the criminal proceedings on the ground that the minor physical injuries sustained by the applicant could have been inflicted DATE and that there was no evidence that they had been inflicted by S. In particular , there was no medical evidence to confirm when the applicant had received the head injury . ORG employees testified that PERSON had not beaten the applicant and the only witness who testified otherwise ( PERSON ) had not physically been able to see the events in question ; this had been confirmed in a reconstruction of the events .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of Kharkiv quashed the decision of DATE and ordered that the criminal proceedings be reopened . The court emphasised that the investigation had failed to find out how the applicant had received the injuries in question .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was declared a victim of an alleged crime .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant introduced a civil claim for compensation for pecuniary damage against S. to be considered in the course of the criminal proceedings .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to institute criminal proceedings for abuse of power against S. , for want of corpus delicti .
CARDINAL . On DATE a forensic medical examination concluded that on DATE the applicant had had bruises on his abdomen which could have been inflicted on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG discontinued the criminal proceedings for the infliction of moderately severe physical injuries , in the absence of evidence of a crime .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the decision of DATE and remitted the case back for further investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of ORG quashed the decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE a fresh medical examination again concluded that on DATE the applicant had had bruises on his abdomen which could have been inflicted on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG terminated the criminal proceedings on the ground that it was not possible to establish with sufficient certainty that the injuries suffered by the applicant had been inflicted by S. Moreover , the injuries sustained ( bruises on the applicant 's abdomen ) were classified as minor and in this case , according to LAW , the applicant should have brought a private prosecution directly before the court .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to institute criminal proceedings against S. on suspicion of burglary , for want of corpus delicti . It was stated that the applicant 's tape recorder had been broken as a result of a dispute which had occurred on DATE between the applicant and S. However , the applicant had provoked PERSON 's reaction by trying to record their conversation .
CARDINAL . By letters of DATE , DATE and DATE and DATE and DATE , ORG informed the applicant that the criminal proceedings had been terminated lawfully .

CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted defamation proceedings in ORG of ORG against ORG . He stated that he had submitted numerous complaints of violations to different ORG authorities . These had been forwarded to ORG , which in its response letters to the NORP ORG Commissioner for Human Rights , to the Member of ORG , L. , and to ORG , had provided false information about the actions of the tax police in respect of the applicant 's enterprise and about the investigation in the applicant 's criminal case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court upheld the applicant 's complaint .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of Appeal quashed the judgment of DATE and rejected the applicant 's complaint as unsubstantiated .
CARDINAL . On DATE a panel of CARDINAL judges of ORG rejected the applicant 's request for leave to appeal under the cassation procedure .

CARDINAL . On an unidentified date the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG against ORG , claiming that he had unlawfully refused to examine the applicant 's complaints . On DATE the court returned the applicant 's complaint as he had failed to comply with the procedural requirements .
CARDINAL . The relevant provision of the LAW of GPE reads as follows :
Article CARDINAL
“ Everyone has the right to respect for his or her dignity .
No one shall be subjected to torture , cruel , inhuman or degrading treatment or punishment that violates his or her dignity . ... ”

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the LAW provides that the court , prosecutor or investigator must , to the extent that it is within their power to do so , institute criminal proceedings in every case where signs of a crime have been discovered , take all necessary measures provided by law to establish whether a crime has been committed and the identity of the perpetrators and punish them .

CARDINAL . In accordance with LAW criminal proceedings on infliction of minor physical injuries are instituted by the courts following complaints by the victims ( private prosecution proceedings ) . No pre - trial investigation is held in such cases .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the Code provides that an investigator 's decision to discontinue the proceedings can be appealed against to the prosecutor or to the court .
